result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony John Machones in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony John Machones is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony John Machones

records.addlTxt: Transcript of the Plea/sentencing hearing held on September 26, 2022

9:23 AM Defendant Anthony John Machones in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Anthony John Machones.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF4, 22CF6, 22CF7, and 21CF356. State recites agreement. Dismiss 22CF4 in its entirety. In 21CF356, agreement will be revoked and defendant will be sentenced on count 2 to 4 years prison fashioned as 2 year IC and 2 years ES. Sentence will be concurrent to sentence in 22CF6 and 22CF7. In 22CF6, Defendant will plead to counts 1 and 2. Count 2 will be amended to disorderly conduct with repeaters. Sentence will be concurrent on each count but will run consecutive to 22CF07 and 19CF299. In 22CF7, Defendant will plead to counts 1 and 2. Count 3 will be dismissed and count 4 will be dismissed but read in. Sentence of 3.5 year prison fashioned as 1.5 years IC and 2 years ES. Concurrent on each count but consecutive to 22CF6. State is in compliance with Victim's rights. Attorney Hoffman notes that another attorney was assigned to the case of 21CF356 and they will not be appearing today but are in agreement with how it is to be resolved. 
Defendant pleads to no contest counts 1 and 2 in 22CF6. In 22CF7, defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the pleas and finds that the defendant's pleas have been knowingly, freely, and voluntarily made. Judgement of conviction is entered, 22CF4 is dismissed. In 21CF356, Count 2, court terminates the deferred agreement.

Court orders in 22CF6, sentence in Count 1 will be 2 years IC with 2 years ES. Count 2 will be 2 years IC, with no ES. Prison sentence will be concurrent on each count but will run consecutive to 22CF07 and 19CF299, concurrent to 21CF356. Probation conditions will be programming as deemed appropriate by DOC and payment of mandatory court costs. Defendant will not be eligible for programming. Any remaining counts dismissed. 

In 22CF7, Count 1, sentence of 3.5 year prison fashioned as 1.5 years IC and 2 years ES. Count 2 Sentence of 3.5 year prison fashioned as 1.5 years IC and 2 years ES. Concurrent on each count but consecutive to 22CF6 and 19CF299, concurrent to 21CF356. Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC and payment of mandatory court costs. Defendant will be eligible for programming. Count 3 is dismissed and count 4 is dismissed but read in. 

In 21CF356, Count 2 sentence will be 4 years prison fashioned as 2 year IC and 2 years ES. Sentence will be concurrent with sentence in 22CF6, 22CF7, 19CF299. conditions of DOC programming and payment of mandatory court costs.  Defendant is eligible for programming.

9:23 AM Defendant Anthony John Machones in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Anthony John Machones.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman asks for another status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:04 PM Defendant Anthony John Machones in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Anthony John Machones in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Pleads not guilty. Court accepts the plea of not guilty.   States request on bail: 22CF4 $1000 Cash bond with no specific conditions; 22CF6 $2500 cash bond and conditions of   No contact with victim 1 or 2 or the address; 22CF7 $1000 cash bond with conditions of   No contact with victims 1 or 2 and the address listed in the ID Key. State recites prior criminal history for the State of Wisconsin. State also recites criminal history for the State of Minnesota. Several F.T.A.'s
Attorney Hoffman asserts Defendant has family and local ties; Lifelong Douglas County Resident. Attorney indicates Defendant has little to no money to pay bail.
Court acknowledges DJOC, prior failures to appear, probation revocations, bail jumping, and for these reasons the Court will impose all cash bonds requested by the State with the conditions of 22CF4 $1000 cash bond with no specific conditions, 22CF6 - $2500 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victims 1 or 2 or their residences; 22CF7 - $1000 cash bond with conditions no victims 1 or 2 or their addresses.
Attorney does indicate defendant does qualify.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
